file_content.text: I'll meet you back at camp once this thing is ready to travel.
It's best this way. I couldn't sleep knowing the pirates could patch together another Null Cannon.
The hangar is secure... for now, anyway.
They should have brought more pirates.
That was easy.
Right. Because on Hoth, a day without pirates would be like a day without frostbite.
You showed up just in the nick of time.
Thanks for the backup.
You know, if you want to mention that to Admiral Revald, that's fine by me.
How are you holding up?
I've got a few minor blaster burns, but none of the Talz seem to be in pieces, so I think we're fine for the moment.
So that... could have gone better.
It couldn't have gone worse unless the planet exploded in a massive fireball.
That's an understatement.
At least we'd be warm for that fraction of a second before we all died.
Everything was under control until you barged in here!
You idiot!
I'll admit, that probably just earned me tauntaun cleanup duty for the next month.
No use dwelling on it.
I'd better call in and report.
Arim... that you? Heavy fire... a lot of... interference. What... status?
Sir, we have the Null Cannon, but there's been a complication.
What was...? Breaking up... secure for immediate....
Blast it! I can't get the signal back. Now what do we do?
We were sent in here for the Null Cannon, and now we get it out of here.
We have our orders.
We were sent in here for one Null Cannon. Singular. Not dozens.
What do you mean?
We had no idea the pirates had reverse-engineered the Null Cannon.
I've done what I was sent here to do. This is all yours.
Not my problem.
You can't leave me in charge of this! I'm not even an officer!
The forces we have can just about hold this hangar long enough to get the prototype out of here. But the rest of these copies....
The other pirates will get here soon. And once they have a weapon that can disable a capital ship, how many innocent people will die?
I don't even want to think about pirates armed with Null Cannons.
I see your point.
Neither do I.
Let them send more pirates, we can handle them.
It's not that dire.
We don't have a transport that can carry all of these copies off Hoth. We'd be defending this hangar for weeks. Maybe months.
So how do we stop them?
The only way to keep the copies out of the pirates' hands is to overload the Null Cannon prototype, wipe out everything in the hangar at once.
The prototype would be fried, but I'd rather spend months fixing it than live knowing that even one of these copies was left behind.
You're right. We can't let even one of these copies fall into the wrong hands.
Overload the Null Cannon.
Stand back.
That should do it.
We need this weapon to fight the Empire. We have to bring it back in working condition.
No, we're following orders.
I guess the admiral will be happy, anyway.
I'll go ahead and get the transport ready. I'll see you back at camp.
Hoth is bad enough without pirates to worry about!
Still no word from the field. Probably the Talz have frozen to death or been killed by pirates. Lucky furballs.
